segments.text: I notice the woman standing in the puddle, and it’s making me feel really sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just drying that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long they’ve been doing this before she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is really going for it, stretching as far as he can.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think he’s going to fall, but he’s so determined to get those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just waiting patiently, like she’s done this before.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel bad for the woman when she finally realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she’s still not reacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this is the saddest kitchen scene I’ve ever seen.
segments.speaker: PAR
